page.title: 16Home life in Bwlchysarnau
page.content: Some of the families consist of several generations under one roof or very close by. Older people, if they don't live with their children, often retire to a bungalow in Rhayeder. Conversely someof the people that have moved into the area are retired couples. The local shop is 3 miles away, but a mobile shop tours the farms once a week, especially welcome during the winter months, but bulk buying tends to be done at the supermarkets of the surrounding towns. The older families still have a 'best' parlour only used on special occasions, and a large farm kitchen which is used for most everyday activities. Nearly everyone has a freezer to store large amounts of food for the winter or busy spells on the farm.
